intro: Stenotyla panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian starwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Central America. It is a shrub characterized by its small, opposite, elliptic leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Stenotyla panamensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as tropical forests and along stream banks.
